intro: Biondia crassipes, commonly known as the thick-stemmed biondia, is a tropical shrub native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by small, fleshy fruits. Biondia crassipes is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
